intro: Pulmonaria × czywczynensis, commonly known as the hybrid lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of velvety, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy clusters of pink or purple flowers in early spring, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
